Sentencas: Yttrium-doped SrTiO3 (SYT) was assessed as an anode material for solid oxide fuel cells in terms of electrical conductivity, phase stability, redox behavior, chemical compatibility with yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O2.8 (LSGM), thermal expansion coefficient, and fuel cell performance.
Titulo: Evaluation of yttrium-doped SrTiO3 as an anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: With the optimized composition Sr0.86Y0.08TiO3-delta, the electrical conductivity was as high as 82 S/cm at 800 degreesC and oxygen partial pressure of 10(-19) atm.
Titulo: Evaluation of yttrium-doped SrTiO3 as an anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A reversible change of conductivity was observed upon oxidation and reduction.
Titulo: Evaluation of yttrium-doped SrTiO3 as an anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The resistance to oxidation was enhanced by partially replacing Ti with transition metals such as cobalt.
Titulo: Evaluation of yttrium-doped SrTiO3 as an anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This material has high structural stability over a broad range of temperature (up to 1400 degreesC) and oxygen partial pressure (1-10(-20) atm).
Titulo: Evaluation of yttrium-doped SrTiO3 as an anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: No phase change was found for mixtures of SYT with YSZ or LSGM sintered at 1400 degreesC for 10 h. The thermal expansion of doped-SrTiO3 was determined to be compatible with that of YSZ and LSGM.
Titulo: Evaluation of yttrium-doped SrTiO3 as an anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A maximum power density of 58 mW/cm(2) at 900 degreesC was obtained for single cells with the new anode.
Titulo: Evaluation of yttrium-doped SrTiO3 as an anode for solid oxide fuel cells
